name: Scan plane
description: This is the plane in which the scan is performed.

name: FOV in phase encoding direction
description: The phase encoding direction is generally the left to right direction of the acquired image. Therefore, this parameter defines the width of the image. In reality, the phase encoding and frequency encoding directions can be switched but for simplicity we assume for now that the phase encoding direction is the left to right direction.

name: FOV in frequency encoding direction
description: The frequency encoding direction is generally the top to bottom direction of the acquired image. Therefore, this parameter defines the height of the image. In reality, the phase encoding and frequency encoding directions can be switched but for simplicity we assume for now that the frequency encoding direction is the top to bottom direction.

name: Rotation Lock
description: This limits the rotation axes to allow for one specific axis only. To be used to disable confusing rotations

name: Scan technique
description: This is the type of scan that is performed. SE stands for spin echo and GE stands for gradient echo.

name: Echo time (TE)
description: This is the time between the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo signal.

name: Repitition time (TR)
description: This is the time between subsequent excitation pulses.

name: Inversion time (TI)
description: This is the time between the inversion pulse and the excitation pulse.

name: Flip angle
description: This is the angle between the excitation pulse and the longitudinal axis of the magnetization vector.
